snippet: In a new tactic for countering the data assault, offices are giving workers a second computer screen and sometimes a third.
abstract: Many companies have begun offering multiple computer screens to employees in a new tactic for countering data deluge; move reflects a broader trend of people opting to have more than one computer monitor even in their homes, as they battle the barrage of e-mails and instant messages, juggling documents, Web sites and online calendars; although it is unclear whether using multiple monitors increases productivity, research suggests that multiple monitors seem to give people a sense of control over the amount of data they consume daily.
lead_paragraph: In a new tactic for countering the data assault, offices are giving workers a second computer screen and sometimes a third.

headline.seo: For Multitaskers, Multiple Monitors Improve Office Efficiency
headline.main: In Data Deluge, Multitaskers Go to Multiscreens
headline.print_headline: In Data Deluge, Multitaskers Go To Multiscreens
